channel.title: Lewis R Elliott
channel.description: Recent content on Lewis R Elliott

item.title: About
item.description: I am currently a Lecturer in Environment and Public Health at the European Centre for Environment and Human Health at the University of Exeter, UK. Research My research primarily concerns the benefits that the natural environment has on human physical health and psychological well-being. I primarily use quantitative methods and the analysis of large surveys in my work, though I have experience of experimental and intervention research as well. I am currently co-I on a number of research projects including GroundsWell, Smartline, and What does blue do for you?
item.content:
I am currently a Lecturer in Environment and Public Health at the European Centre for Environment and Human Health at the University of Exeter, UK.

Research

My research primarily concerns the benefits that the natural environment has on human physical health and psychological well-being. I primarily use quantitative methods and the analysis of large surveys in my work, though I have experience of experimental and intervention research as well. I am currently co-I on a number of research projects including GroundsWell, Smartline, and What does blue do for you?. I previously worked extensively as a post-doc on the EU Horizon 2020 funded BlueHealth project.

Teaching

As for teaching, I lead a module on Nature, Health, and Well-being for the MSc Environment and Human Health where I also lecture on quantitative methods and statistics. I co-convene a CPD course on the same topic. I also lecture or lead research groups for the BMBS programme, BSc Medical Sciences, and for a module on Oceans and Human Health.

item.title: Lewis Elliott PhD MSc BSc
item.description: Hi. I built this website to consolidate and better organise my academic work than I thought was possible with pre-existing platforms like ResearchGate or Google Scholar. I also aim to (gradually) my work more ‘open’ by including published papers as well as their draft versions, revisions, and peer reviews/responses, along with (where possible) related data and code.
item.content: Hi. I built this website to consolidate and better organise my academic work than I thought was possible with pre-existing platforms like ResearchGate or Google Scholar. I also aim to (gradually) my work more ‘open’ by including published papers as well as their draft versions, revisions, and peer reviews/responses, along with (where possible) related data and code.
